node.title: We are embarrassed:' Energy company apologises after telling users to exercise, cuddle pets to keep warm
node.description: The UK is facing a energy crisis with energy bills predicted to rise by up to 50 percent.
node.content: ["An energy company in the UK is under fire after it advised customers to do star jumps, cuddle pets and eat porridge to keep warm.", "One of Britain's largest energy companies, OVO Energy, apologised after the \"poorly judged\" blog post containing the tips to keep warm was sent to its customers.", "\"We understand how difficult the situation will be for many of our customers this year,\" OVO Energy said in a statement reported by Sky News.", "\"We are working hard to find meaningful solutions as we approach this energy crisis, and we recognise that the content of this blog was poorly judged and unhelpful. We are embarrassed and sincerely apologise.\"", "The UK is facing an energy crisis with energy bills predicted to rise by up to 50 percent in April, the BBC reported.", "In OVO Energy's now-deleted blog post were tips on how to cut back on heating, such as wearing more clothes, opening the curtains and leaving your oven open after cooking.", "Sky News reported politician Darren Jones said he is glad the company apologised.", "\"I'm not sure who signed off a marketing campaign telling people to wear a jumper and eat porridge instead of turning on the heating if you can't afford it,\" Jones wrote on Twitter."]
